comments:
In Version: 3.0.0
Build id: 200312182000

Type the following in the Java editor, in the header of a class :

private MouseTrackAdapter mouseTrackListener = new MouseTrackAdapter() { XXX };

right mouse click where the XXX in the above line is and choose Source -> 
Override/Implement methods. You get the correct methods in the pop up. choose 
some, and say ok. You get an error and the methods are not generated.

you get a dialog plus the following in .log:

fixed > 20040211

Overriding methods in anonlymous classes is currently not supported.

Martin,
what do you mean fixed!? do you mean that there will no longer be a stack 
dump? will I still be able to get to the source -> override methods action? 
If this is not supported, what is a quick way to code - complete the inner 
class? does CTRL-Space work to complete inner classes? 

This is a major feature for inner classes? don't you think? 
When you are witting adapters, you don't know all the methods and you want to 
be able to quickly generate them.
